intro: Stylocoryna conferta, commonly known as the narrow-leafed rock heath, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes heathers and related shrubs. The plant is characterized by its compact, evergreen shrub form with small, leathery leaves. It produces clusters of bell-shaped, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in late spring or early summer. Stylocoryna conferta is adapted to grow in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in mountainous regions.
